text: Ole Johan Olsen (6 December 1884 - 31 May 1939) was a Norwegian politician. Olsen was born in Kristiansand to firefighter Anton Martin Olsen and Mathilde Fredrikke Pedersen. He was elected representative to the Stortinget for the periods 1928-1930, 1931-1933, 1934-1936 and 1937-1945, for the Labour Party. ==References== Category:1884 births Category:1939 deaths Category:Politicians from Kristiansand Category:Labour Party (Norway) politicians Category:Members of the Storting
title: Ole Johan Olsen
